body:
Every year, the China Central Television’s annual New Year Gala , the most important cultural show, provides mainland Chinese people some hot topics for discussion during the Lunar New Year holiday. This year, the rural migrant workers' performance has caught the public attention. 

Two migrant worker programs were featured in the Gala. The first one was the migrant worker singing duo Xuriyanggang 's performance on the popular song, In Spring, depicting a man's aspiration for a simple rural life: 



The second one was 

they are In Spring a song covered by migrant workers singing duo Xuriyanggang , and a massive street dance show  by a migrant workers troupe from Shenzhen. Both performances received strong reaction from popular Chinese actors, media commentators and ordinary citizens. The migrant workers’ covered version of In Spring even beat famous Chinese comedian Zhao Benshan’s sketch and was voted by Sina microbloggers as their favorite spring gala program.

One of the Xuriyanggang members, Wang Xun, said at an after-show interview by Beijing Daily that he would have never imagined him on the stage of CCTV New Year Gala. “You know, CCTV New Year Gala commands a very high threshold， whereas I was there two or three months after our band became a hit on the internet.”

"农民工兄弟站上春晚舞台，说明他们越来越被认可，越来越被尊重，而这也是新生代农民工最渴望的。眼下，“80后”、“90后”农民工已经占到农民工总数的60％，慢慢成为了农民工的主力军。与父辈不同，他们个性张扬，无所畏惧。"

Yangzi Evening News  commented that migrant workers stepping on the stage of spring festival gala demonstrated they are being recognized and respected. At present, the number of migrant workers born in the 1980s and the 1990s has taken up 60% of migrant workers in the country, and are slowly becoming the task force of migrant workers group. Unlike their fathers’ generation, they are fearless, better educated and have showed and enjoyed great individualism.

"印象深的就是那个农民工（旭日阳刚）唱的歌（《春天里》）,唱得已经非常好了，声情并茂。而且你能听出那个声音是从内心里释放出来的，里面有朴实，有感动。"

“I was impressed by migrant workers’ interpretation of In Spring. Xunriyanggang showed great singing skills. You can tell the voice is from their hearts, simple yet very touching,” said Sun Haiying, a senior Chinese movie star best known for his genuine portraits of ordinary workers and soldiers, at an interview with The Beijing News .

It was not the first time that CCTV invited migrant workers to its spring festival gala. In 2007, it featured an over 3-minute long poem reading section by 30 ordinary migrant workers’ children. Their parents are from 24 cities and provinces across the country and are working in low-income industries in Beijing. Many netizens said the poem reading was the most moving program in the 2007 gala.

"如果承认国家实行的义务教育是面向所有中小学生，就应该认识到民工子弟不管走到哪里，都有权利沐浴在义务教育的阳光之下。而残酷的现实却是，民工子弟进城上学，犹如他们父辈当年进城打工一样，处处受到歧视。"

A Netease blogger , after watching this show, pointed out it is not a rare phenomenon that migrant workers’ children are often discriminated and bullied in the city. They should enjoy equal education opportunities like their urban peers whose parents have urban household registry.

The introduction lines to migrant workers’ shows by the gala hosts are questioned by netizens. One blogger at Sina  expressed his concern on how to address migrant workers, as the current title, 农民工（migrant workers）indicates slight discrimination and inequality.

"没有这些多数群体的存在与支持，我们所谓的城里人吃什么？喝什么"

“They have made enormous contribution to our city residents’ lives. Without them, what can we eat? What can we drink?”The blogger pointed out delegates from Hong Kong and Macau had proposed to moderate the title of migrant workers at the 11th National People’s Congress in 2007.

From the two migrant workers’ programs in the 2011 CCTV New Year Gala, the general public is not only concerned about Xuriyanggang the band, but they owe deep apology and sympathy to migrant workers group as a whole, according to a commentary from Xinhua Net.

"公众关注旭日阳刚,被《春天里》所感动,不仅是关注两个人的命运,更有对农民工这个群体的歉疚和同情。如何让他们不再“老无所依”,不要在城市奉献了自己的青春然后“悄然离去”,是所有良知尚存、对公平正义心怀向往的人,都无法漠视的问题,更是温家宝总理所说的“政府的职责和良心”。"

Of their many concerns, how to get them proper retirement insurance instead of giving them up when they are old and can make no more contribution to the city is an inescapable question facing all citizens and challenging the government’s conscience.
